Heartbroken by today’s horrible shooting in Buffalo, an unspeakable act of hate. My prayers go to the victims and their families. And my thanks go to the courageous first responders on the scene who handled a very difficult situation.
And I’ll be listening and watching for any sign that seventeen Republican Senators won’t look the other way and will stand up for our country. [END]
Senators will relive the horror of the attack on the Capitol, see and hear new evidence about what happened and the big lie President Trump told that the election was stolen.
So as this trial proceeds, from my vantage point in the second row to the left of the dais, I will be listening and watching.

I say some Republicans. Not all of them.  I work with Republican colleagues every day, people I respect even when I disagree with them.  I’m by nature an optimist - how else could I work in the Senate?
(Senator Lindsey Graham, who the night of the attack said he “was done,” tweeted today that he hopes the House Managers won’t take too long since the outcome of the trial is clear.)
But here’s what really infuriates me: watching some Republican Senators do everything they can to look the other way in order to avoid standing up for our country and against this criminal behavior.

And I’m heartsick that after the windows were broken, and the injured were given aid, the mostly Black custodial staff were left to sweep up the trash in the building built by their enslaved ancestors.
I’m furious that, inside the Senate, some Republican Senators actively supported the lie that the election was stolen, and did what they could to overturn our election.
I’m angry and heartbroken about the loss of Officer Sicknick, and the other Capitol police that died by suicide in the following days.
I’m angry about the staffers and journalists and members of Congress who were terrified for their lives because these people sent by the President were chanting about assassination and lynching.

Another impeachment trial has begun in the Senate.

And I am angry.  I’m angry about the rabid right-wing extremists and white supremacists who attacked our Capitol, so sure they would never pay for their actions because the President had sent them. [THREAD]

I have a feeling Trump's 6pm tweet from January 6th ("Remember this day forever!") is going to show up over and over again in this trial (the managers brought it up twice today). It's essentially an admission of guilt.
